statements.status_notes: Derby is only utilized in an in-process fashion, where remote authentication (including LDAP) is not utilized.
False positive. This CVE was fixed in 25.2 upstream pip and underlying Python in DHI

The vulnerability affects all versions of Apache Spark with no fix currently available. DHI Spark images are typically deployed in authenticated cluster environments or used in contexts where the standalone resource manager's master-worker architecture is not directly exposed to untrusted input, significantly reducing the attack surface. Additionally the DHI spark image is having the authentication enabled by default, meaning that the vulnerability can only be exploited if the user explicitly disables spark.authentication while running in standalone mode.
Waiting on upstream dependency release.

CVE-2020-13949 affects Apache Thrift libthrift 0.12.0 used by Spark 3.5.6. The vulnerability describes malicious RPC clients causing large memory allocation leading to denial of service. The fix is available in libthrift 0.14.0, but Spark 3.5.6 has hardcoded dependency on libthrift 0.12.0. Upgrading would require Apache Spark upstream to validate compatibility with newer Thrift versions (0.12.0 → 0.14.0), which represents a major version jump with potential breaking changes in Spark's distributed RPC communication layer.

CVE-2019-0205 affects Apache Thrift libthrift 0.12.0 used by Spark 3.5.6. The vulnerability is fixable in libthrift 0.13.0, but Spark 3.5.6 has hardcoded dependency on libthrift 0.12.0 in its core pom.xml. Upgrading would require Apache Spark upstream to validate compatibility with newer Thrift versions and update their dependency management. A major version upgrade (0.12.0 → 0.13.0) carries significant risk of breaking Spark's internal Thrift integration used for distributed computing communication.
Waiting on upstream dependency release.

Waiting on upstream dependency release.
This vulnerability applies to unauthorized or underprivileged users of Apache Hive however Spark is only utilizing Hive through a jdbc

CVE-2020-8908 affects Google Guava 14.0.1 used by Spark 3.5.6. The vulnerability involves temporary file creation with overly permissive permissions. The fix is available in Guava 32.0.0-android, but Spark 3.5.6 has hardcoded dependency on guava.version 14.0.1. This represents an extreme version jump requiring extensive compatibility validation and likely code refactoring throughout Spark's codebase that relies on Guava's foundational utility classes.

CVE-2023-2976 affects Google Guava 14.0.1 used by Spark 3.5.6. The vulnerability is fixable in Guava 32.0.0-android, but Spark 3.5.6 has hardcoded dependency on guava.version 14.0.1. This represents an extreme version jump (14.0.1 → 32.0.0) spanning over a decade of API changes and breaking modifications. The upgrade would require extensive refactoring across Spark's entire codebase that depends on Guava's collection utilities, caching, and concurrency primitives.

CVE-2018-10237 affects Google Guava 14.0.1 used by Spark 3.5.6. The vulnerability is fixable in Guava 24.1.1-android, but Spark 3.5.6 has hardcoded dependency on guava.version 14.0.1 (released in 2013). This represents a massive version jump spanning over 10 years of development that would introduce significant breaking changes in Google's core utility library used throughout Spark's codebase. Such an upgrade requires extensive compatibility testing and likely code changes across Spark's entire codebase.
Waiting on upstream dependency release.
Upstream patch applied; see https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/137027
Vulnerability only affects Go servers, but Spark has no Go components.
This CVE is disputed and not considered a security vulnerability by upstream.
This CVE is marked as unimportant and specific to configurations using SELinux, which is not applicable here.

Fault injection based attacks are not within OpenSSLs threat model according to the security policy and this CVE is not treated as security bug by upstream: https://www.openssl.org/policies/general/security-policy.html

The only viable vector for exploitation of this bug is local, if a static setuid program exists, and that program calls dlopen, then it may search LD_LIBRARY_PATH to locate the SONAME to load. No such program is present in the container image .
Uncontrolled recursion in regex processing. Maintainer disputes this as a vulnerability as it only occurs with crafted patterns.
ASLR bypass for pthread_created thread heap addresses. Vendor states ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability.
ASLR bypass using thread stack and heap cache. Not treated as security bug by upstream.
Requires user to explicitly run ldd on malicious ELF files. Classified as non-security bug by upstream.
Classified as non-security bug by upstream. Stack guard protection bypass is considered unimportant.
Not treated as vulnerability by upstream glibc. Listed under glibc Security Exceptions.
Standard POSIX behavior in glibc. Applications using glob need to impose limits themselves. Requires authenticated access and is considered unimportant by Debian.
This CVE is not treated as security issue by upstream; just a crash in a CLI tool.
This CVE is not treated as security issue by upstream and reflects intended behavior of the chown program.
Marked no-dsa by Debian Security Team; see https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2025-6141
